channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Chinese biotech firm opens COVID-19 test laboratory in Pampanga
item.author: Franco Luna
item.description: With the launching of the new laboratory, the embassy said, some 3,000 samples can be tested for COVID-19 each day.

item.title: Two Chinese vessels chase Japanese fishing boat near disputed islets
item.description: The flashpoint islands, called Senkaku in Japan and known in China as the Diaoyus, are at the center of a festering row between Tokyo and Beijing.

item.title: Anti-communist task force, PCOO spread false claims on ABS-CBN franchise
item.description: "The posted content is not in any way an official statement or an opinion of the PCOO. The issue regarding ABS-CBN's Corporation's network franchise remains in the purview of Congress," Presidential Communications Secretary Andanar said.

item.title: Go Negosyo inks MOA with six government hospitals
item.author: Louella Desiderio
item.description: Go Negosyo has entered into a memorandum of agreement (MOA) with six government hospital beneficiaries of Reverse Transcription-Polymerase Chain Reaction machines from the private sector under Project Antibody Rapid test Kit.

item.title: Ensure peace, order to make ‘Balik Probinsya’ work
item.author: Cecille Suerte Felipe
item.description: Sen. Bong Go urged the Department of the Interior and Local Government, local officials and law enforcers to maintain peace and order to ensure the success of the “Balik Probinsya” Program.

item.title: LTO extends validity of vehicle registration, licenses
item.author: Romina Cabrera
item.description: The Land Transportation Office will extend the validity of vehicle registrations as well as licenses and permits under their jurisdiction for 60 days upon the resumption of work after the easing of the coronavirus disease 2019 lockdown.

item.title: BIR issues guidelines for POGO resumption
item.author: Mary Grace Padin
item.description: The Bureau of Internal Revenue has issued guidelines for the reopening of Philippine offshore gaming operators and their service providers, wherein only tax-compliant firms would be able to partially resume operations.

item.title: International flights at NAIA start tomorrow
item.author: Richmond Mercurio
item.description: For a month starting tomorrow, all inbound charter and commercial international flights to Manila will be able to land at the Ninoy Aquino International Airport only on their assigned days.

item.title: Metro Manila mayors present 3 quarantine scenarios
item.author: Marc Jayson Cayabyab
item.description: After a meeting that lasted for four hours, Metro Manila mayors agreed to let the national government through the Inter Agency Task Force on Managing Emerging Infectious Diseases decide whether or not to maintain the lockdown or allow it to continue in a “modified” form after its scheduled lifting on May 15.

item.title: Filipino toddler recovers from COVID-19 in UAE
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: An 18-month old baby has become the youngest Filipino survivor of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) in the United Arab Emirates (UAE), the Philippine embassy in UAE announced on Friday.
